title: Olivia Kim
text:
Olivia Kim is an undergraduate student at Duke University, Class of 2026. She is pursuing a Bachelor’s of Science in Biology with a minor in Chemistry and a Health Policy Certificate. She aims to solve complex healthcare system challenges by combining disciplines in life sciences, data analytics, and policy analysis to create transformative healthcare strategies and infrastructure designs. Currently, Olivia works as a student analyst/consultant for North Carolina’s statewide health information exchange, NC HealthConnex, as part of a team to assess and plan the implementation of a fully functional health data utility. Additionally, Olivia is one of only four undergraduate scholars at the Margolis Institute for Health Policy, a role for those focused on innovative healthcare management and system improvement research.


Duke University | Durham, North Carolina B.S in Biology | August 2022 - May 2026



NC HealthConnex | Student Analyst | October 2024 - present
FamiliesUSA | Health Policy Intern | May 2024 - August 2024

title: North Carolina Health Data Utility Consulting Project
text: This project aims to assess and plan a transition for North Carolina’s statewide Health Information Exchange (HIE) to become a mature Health Data Utility (HDU). By addressing policy and infrastructure barriers to overcome data interoperability issues across organizations, our goal is to improve care coordination, closed-loop referral tracking, and access to non-medical interventions. This poster was presented at Academy Health’s 2025 Annual Research Meeting and American Medical Informatics Association 2025 Annual Symposium.

title: UHG | Carnegie Mellon UniversityCapstone
text: This is my capstone project that my team of three student researchers produced for the Bridges to Healthcare Technology Program under Carnegie Mellon University and UnitedHealth Group. We aimed to explore and understand the influences on teen birth rates by analyzing county-level data to reach actionable insights and a recommendation for UHG.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis of Covid Vaccine Distribution in California
text: This is my EDA project which I collaborated on with Arturo Espana and Jordan Faustin, students in the Bridges to Healthcare Technology program, which is a joint experience between Carnegie Mellon University and UnitedHealth Group.
